title: 111_hr1526
content:
The Act is titled the "Prescribe A Book Act" and includes definitions. The "Prescribe A Book Act" defines an "eligible entity" as a nonprofit organization with proven effectiveness in providing literacy training to healthcare providers, delivering curriculum in various medical education settings, offering technical assistance for Pediatric Early Literacy Programs, and creating local healthcare opportunities. The "Prescribe A Book Act" offers discounts for local healthcare facilities to obtain books and integrates educational research into training for healthcare providers. The Pediatric Early Literacy Program encourages parents to read aloud to young children. The "Prescribe A Book Act" promotes reading aloud to children by providing books to parents, healthcare providers, and volunteers in healthcare facilities. Research shows positive effects in peer-reviewed journals. The "Prescribe A Book Act" promotes reading aloud to children by providing books to parents, healthcare providers, and volunteers in healthcare facilities. It emphasizes the importance of peer-reviewed research, effectiveness in altering parent behavior, and receiving endorsements from medical associations. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education. The Secretary can award grants to eligible entities for Pediatric Early Literacy Programs. Eligible entities must submit an application and provide matching funds. Grant funds must be used as specified. An eligible entity receiving a grant under this Act must enter into contracts with selected organizations to establish Pediatric Early Literacy Programs. They must provide training and technical assistance to contractors and include terms determined by the Secretary for program effectiveness. Contractors are chosen based on prioritizing at-risk children. The grant under this Act prioritizes serving at-risk children, including low-income children, those without adequate medical insurance, children enrolled in Medicaid or CHIP, children in rural areas, migrant children, and those with limited library access. SEC. 7. RESTRICTION ON PAYMENTS.

Payments to eligible entities require arrangements with book publishers for favorable discounts.

SEC. 8. REPORTING REQUIREMENT.

Entities must report annually on program effectiveness and contractor programs.

SEC. 9. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Authorization of appropriations for the Act: 
- $15,000,000 for fiscal year 2010
- $16,000,000 for fiscal year 2011
- $17,000,000 for fiscal year 2012
- $18,000,000 for fiscal year 2013
- $19,000,000 for fiscal year 2014.
